result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carl David Anderson

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Carl David Anderson
Current: 8761 Merritt Place, Mountain Iron, MN 55768 United States  (Effective: 10-19-2022)
Prior: 1920 Sanford Ave, Duluth, MN 55811 United States

2:00 PM Defendant Carl David Anderson in court.  Attorney Jamy Richard Johansen in court for Carl David Anderson.  Attorney Allison Cogbill in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Address updated to 8761 Merritt Place, Mt. Iron, MN 55768. Acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading, pleads not guilty. Wishes to waive preliminary hearing in this matter and in 22CM367. Court accepts plea accepts waivers and finds knowingly and voluntarily made, finds probable cause, binds over for arraignment. Court quashes warrant. 
State requests $2000 cash bond, no contact with Jenna Anderson or residence. Notes bail modification hearing in prior case. 
Attorney indicates Ms. Anderson wants no violent or abusive contact to continue and would like contact with residence. No missed court. Asks for $1000 cash. 
Victim address court. Does not believe no contact necessary. 
Court makes statements. Court orders $1000 cash in 22CF393, with conditions of no violent or abusive contact with Jenna Anderson, no contact with residence.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment scheduled for January 27, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 216971,
Payable Number: 153205,
Receipt Number: 22R 014590,
Amount: $20.00
No contact with residence of Jenna Anderson. No use or possession of alcohol. No use or possession of a dangerous weapon or firearms. Supervised contact with children as per Jenna Anderson and DA

1:58 PM Defendant Carl David Anderson in court.  Attorney Peter Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case. Court notes letter written by defendant regarding bond. Asking for bond conditions to be modified. Defendant indicates no contact address is his business address. Is primary caregiver for children. Would like to be able to return to address to take care of children. 
State not objecting to amendment of no violent or abusive contact with Victim 1 and may lift the address no contact.  State is still asking for no supervised contact with children except with supervision by JA or someone of her choice. 
Victim addresses court. 
Court makes statements regarding charges. 
Court is inclined not to modify conditions. Supervised contact allowed with children as previously ordered. May have contact with JA but not at residence. All other conditions continue. Defendant asks how close he can be to the residence.
State suggests he contact attorney.
Letter from defendant re: modification of bond conditions
Letter from Commissioner Lovejoy to Defendant Anderson RE ex parte

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: No contact with Jenna Anderson or address on the complaint. The above no contact shall have the exception that the defendant may have a one time contact at the residence with Law Enforcement for property retrieval. Do not possess any firearms or dangerous weapons. No use or possession of alcohol. No unsupervised in person contact with 4 minor children without approval of JA, DA, or his attorney.

1:34 PM Defendant Carl David Anderson appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman appeared by video for Carl David Anderson as a special appearance. Defendant's address confirmed, alternate address given. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor count(s), and requests a preliminary hearing. State asks for $2000 cash. No contact with Jenna Anderson or address on the complaint. The above no contact shall have the exception that the defendant may have a one time contact at the residence with Law Enforcement for property retrieval. Do not possess any firearms or dangerous weapons. No use or possession of alcohol. No unsupervised in person contact with 4 minor children. State notes severity of the charges and recites defendant's prior criminal history. Notes there are not any FTAs. Attorney Hoffman notes that defendant has lived in Superior for 5 years, lifelong resident of Twin Ports. Notes that he has family in the area. Defendant notes that he is attempting to check in to a hospital upon release. Attorney Hoffman can post up $1,000. The Victim would not like to address the court. 
Court notes concerns over address and severity of allegations. 
Court 2,000 cash. No contact with Jenna Anderson or address on the complaint. The above no contact shall have the exception that the defendant may have a one time contact at the residence with Law Enforcement for property retrieval. Do not possess any firearms or dangerous weapons. No use or possession of alcohol. No unsupervised in person contact with 4 minor children without approval of JA, DA, or his attorney.
Defendant does not qualify for public defender services. Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing to allow for time to retain counsel. Court accepts the waiver as knowingly and voluntarily made.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
